Pre-Game Insights: Paul George and his 76ers will play their first game of the season against the undefeated Cavaliers.
Joel Embiid, who has been injured, played his first game but did not perform well, scoring 13 points in 26 minutes.
The 76ers are currently last in their conference with a record of 2 wins and 8 losses.
The Cavaliers are unbeaten with a perfect 12-0 record and are aiming to break the record for the longest undefeated start in NBA history.
Mitchell and Garland have formed a complementary backcourt for the Cavaliers.
Andre Drummond will start at center instead of Joel Embiid to preserve his body.
The 76ers have lost their last 4 games at home, while the Cavaliers have won all their away games.
